segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā anuruddho sāvatthiyaṃ viharati andhavanasmiṃ ābādhiko dukkhito bāḷhagilāno.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Anuruddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Dark Forest. And he was sick, suffering, gravely ill.

segments.pli: Atha kho sambahulā bhikkhū yenāyasmā anuruddho tenupasaṅkamiṃsu; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ anuruddhaṃ etadavocuṃ:
segments.en: Then several mendicants went up to Venerable Anuruddha, and said to him:

segments.pli: “Katamenāyasmato anuruddhassa vihārena viharato uppannā sārīrikā dukkhā vedanā cittaṃ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhantī”ti?
segments.en: “What meditation does Venerable Anuruddha practice so that physical pain doesn’t occupy his mind?”

segments.pli: “Catūsu kho me, āvuso, satipaṭṭhānesu suppatiṭṭhitacittassa viharato uppannā sārīrikā dukkhā vedanā cittaṃ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhanti.
segments.en: “Reverends, I meditate with my mind firmly established in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation so that physical pain doesn’t occupy my mind.

segments.pli: Idhāhaṃ, āvuso, kāye kāyānupassī viharāmi … pe …
segments.en: I meditate observing an aspect of the body …

segments.pli: dhammesu dhammānupassī viharāmi ātāpī sampajāno satimā, vineyya loke abhijjhādomanassaṃ—
segments.en: principles—keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.

segments.pli: imesu kho me, āvuso, catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu suppatiṭṭhitacittassa viharato uppannā sārīrikā dukkhā vedanā cittaṃ na pariyādāya tiṭṭhantī”ti.
segments.en: I meditate with my mind firmly established in these four kinds of mindfulness meditation so that physical pain doesn’t occupy my mind.”

sections.title: At one time Venerable Anuruddha was staying near Sāvatthī…

suttaplex.blurb: Some mendicants ask Anuruddha how he remains equanimous even though ill. He replies that it is due to the four kinds of mindfulness meditation.
